title: Swimming - Floating and Breathing Techniques
description: Comprehensive test on swimming gear, styles, breathing techniques, and water safety

questions.text: What is the primary purpose of swimming in emergency situations?
questions.explanation: Swimming provides survival capability during emergencies, accidents, or evacuations, keeping you alive until assistance reaches.

questions.text: Which swimming gear protects the eyes and improves underwater visibility?
questions.explanation: Goggles protect eyes from water and chlorine while improving underwater visibility for better swimming technique.

questions.text: Which swimming style is performed with the chest facing the sky?
questions.explanation: Back Stroke (also called back crawl) is performed lying on the back with chest facing upward.

questions.text: What type of kick is used in breast stroke?
questions.explanation: Breast stroke uses a frog kick where legs move in a circular, frog-like motion.

questions.text: Where should exhalation primarily occur during swimming?
questions.explanation: Exhalation must be done under water, allowing quick inhalation when mouth comes above water.

questions.text: What is the 'bow wave' created during swimming?

options.b: A wave created by head and body moving through water
options.c: A wave from arm movements only

questions.explanation: Bow wave is created by the head and body moving through water, which can be used for breathing.

questions.text: Which swimming style uses dolphin kick?
questions.explanation: Butterfly stroke uses dolphin kick where both legs move up and down together like a dolphin's tail.

questions.text: What is the most important safety rule when swimming?
questions.explanation: Never swim alone - this ensures someone can help in case of emergency or difficulty.

questions.text: What should you do to prevent water entering your nose when face is in water?
questions.explanation: Release small amount of air through nose when face is in water to prevent water entry.

questions.text: Which swimming style is described as 'face over water and paddling with alternate hands'?
questions.explanation: Dog Paddle involves keeping face over water while paddling with alternate hands, often with nose and mouth above water.

questions.text: What is the purpose of a drag suit in swimming training?

options.b: To create resistance and build strength

questions.explanation: Drag suit creates water resistance, helping swimmers build strength and power during training.

questions.text: When should you rotate your head for breathing during swimming?
questions.explanation: Rotate head only until you see your sides - over-rotation can disrupt swimming rhythm and balance.

questions.text: Which of these is NOT mentioned as a swimming precaution?
questions.explanation: Documented precautions include knowing depth, no diving in shallow end, proper kit, and following safety instructions - not specifically daytime swimming.

questions.text: What coordination is essential for good swimming?
questions.explanation: Good swimming requires balanced coordination of breathing, mental focus, physical movements, strength and stamina.

questions.text: Which equipment helps with leg strength and kick technique?
questions.explanation: Kick board supports upper body, allowing focus on leg movements and kick technique development.
